The first picture in the album was of three kids, two boys and one girl, no older then Ash. The young girl, standing in the middle was no other then Delia herself. The two boys were her friends, who she traveled with. Bob Rockets and Hank Katchum, the father of Ash, himself.

Delia still could remember those days fairly well. She remembered how head strong she was, just like Ash. Luckily she had a couple of good friends, like her son does, or she would probably have never made it.

'Hmm, I wonder what's Bob's doing now?' Delia asked herself.

"Mr. Mine?" a familiar voice asked curiously.

"Oh, Miny, you startled me," Delia said with that sweet smile of her. She then notice Mr. Mine's staring at her album curiously. "You want to know about this?"

Mr. Mine nodded his head eagerly and Delia just smiled more.

"Well when I was younger I looked to take a lot of pictures, while I was traveling around. These boys were my first friends I meant while traveling. I fell in love with Hank and married him, once we were both down with pokemon. I have seen bob Rockets in years," Delia explained in a ever deeper sadden tone.

Mr. Mine put his finger to his mouth, feeling the sadness coming off of the adult woman. It seems that remembering this was making Delia feel her age. She seems to snap out of it as she looked at the clock and realized what time it was.

"Oh look, it's dinner time," She said, standing up and putting on her usual smile. "What to help me, Mimy?"

Mr. Mime cheered up instantly and want about his usual routine of helping Ash's mother. Delia took one last, longing look at her old album before putting it away and got starting on dinner.

After dinner and a little more cleaning, Delia turned in. Wearing a light pink night gown, she got into bed and instantly fell asleep, dreaming of the her younger days. Unknown to the adult woman, there was an extra being in the house at the time.

The Celebi that Ask and Sammy Oak saved a whole back have came to Pallet Town to check up on Oak and had also sense the longing sadness from the woman. It felt like it needed to repay one of the two people who saved his life and decided to gave the mother of his friend one last adventure.

Delia was still surprised when she saw the face of a child, instead of the face of a mature woman. It was also a little freaky to see a face that looked a lot like her son's face.

It was funny when she thought about it. No one she knew had ever said anything about how much Delia and her son looked alike, so she never really thought about it either. Mother and son could almost pass as twins, say for the red hair.

Delia fiercely shook her head, trying to get rid of all of these pointless thoughts, and focus on the task at hand. But the more she stared at the mirror, the more she thought about her son and the likeness they shared.

Deciding to turn her attention away from the mirror, the former adult put the object down and look at the window, located to her left. The rain had finally stop and there was enough of a break in the clouds to see some of the stars in the night sky.

'You know Delia, if you're ever lost, look to the stars, they will guide you to the path you need to follow,' Delia remembered her husband Hank saying to her once in her first childhood.

Delia smiled, realizing what must be done, though it would probably be hard on her new friend Richard.

(Next day...Early morning)

Richard and Delia, sat the kitchen table, enjoying a plate of eggs and bacon, that Richard had prepared. While the farmer was eating at a normal pose, Delia was taking her time, like there was something on her mind.

"Umm, Richard, can I asked you something?" Delia looked up at the farmer, slightly nervous.

Richard nodded his head yes, because his mouth was full of eggs. Delia let out a light sigh as she took a moment to gather her thoughts.

"You said there was a town called Littleroot not far from here, right?" Delia asked, if not slightly nervous for some reason.

Richard swallowed his food and replied kindly," Yes there is."

"Well I was thinking about traveling there and asking that Professor Bitch if he could look at that injured pokemon," Delia replied timidly, then broke eye contact.

Why was this so hard? That was the question Delia was wondering. It just made it that much harder on herself that she felt like a child right at the moment.

It took a few moments for the regressed mother to work up enough courage to look at Richard again. She wasn't prepared for the kind smile and knowing look that farmer has on his face.

"I had a feeling you're be like this," he replied kindly, getting out of his chair. "You stroke me as a free spirit. Someone who could not stay in one place for very long."

he then climbed the stairs, leaving Delia to her confusion. She wondering what he was up too? She didn't have to wait long because the farmer came down with somethings in his hand. Delia was surprise to find him carrying a traveling back, like the one Ash's friend Brock has, and a hat. Surprisingly the hat was just like her son's hat, but this one was white and blue with a red marking in the center.

"Littleroot Town is at least a day walk here and the for cast calls for more rain, so I figure these could come in handle," Richard said kindly.

Delia was in shocked at the farmer's kindness. Here she was, someone who this farmer barely knows, and he was showing her such kindness. It almost brought a tear to her eyes. She opened her mouth to say something, but Richard beat her to it.

"And before you protest about taking these, they'll belong to my niece, but she has not use them in almost a year, so I don't think it would matter to her," Richard said kindly.

Decided it was best not to fight anymore, Delia just took the items with a kind smile. She slip the pack onto her back and then place the hat backward on her head.

"You know that hat seems to suit you well," Richard said kindly.

Delia was still at a lost for words, so she just continued to smile. A few minutes later, the regressed mother was on her way, waving good bye. Richard returned the way as he watched the girl walk away.

'Delia, I don't know if I truly believe your story, but I have seen the heart of a mother behind those eyes of you,' Richard thought peacefully. 'I hope you could fine what you're looking for.'
1512111111.title: What Tomorrow holds?

choices: Should she be in more Danger then before?
15121111111.content:
Delia treaded through the forest lightly, careful not to make any sudden move so the bundle in her arms was safe. She was traveling through the very forest she awoke in last night, thinking it would shave some time off of her journey. To bad, she had forgotten to add two figures into her math. First, she didn't know any inch of this forest, say for the clearing where she had meant Richard. Second, she had forgotten about her poor sense of direction

Delia let out a faint sigh as she looked around for any signs of any sorts. "This was so much more easier back when I travel with Hank and Bob," she muttered to herself.

Suddenly, her stomach let out a light growl, causing her to blush faintly. She didn't how much time she had pass since she had enter this for forest, but she figures it much be around lunch time. That, or breakfast didn't least long with her.

Suddenly remembering about the bag on her back, Delia decided to take a quick snack break. Founding a nice spot with a old fallen tree trunk and just away space between the tree's branch for some sunlight to come through. Setting the injure Pichu down gently next to the tree trunk, the regressed mother took her backpack off as she set down. She was surprise to find some soda and donuts when she first opened the bag.

"Well I have to handle to Richard, he seems to know what I need the most," Delia said with a bit of glee as she took the cup drink and a donut.

She quietly munch on her snack as she tried to get her bearing in this place. It didn't really help matter that she wasn't familiar with the Hoenn area either. Another thing that was causing trouble was the fact that she has two good friends who helped her along on her journey.

'I guess, it has been a long time since I done anything like this,' Delia thought with a depressed sigh.

Suddenly a light moan caught her attention. Looking in the direction of the noise, she saw the Pichu, tossing and turning again. It was in obvious pain and Delia was at a lost. She remember seeing some medical tap in her bag, but she didn't remember seeing any could of cream to help ease the pain. That's when she saw it. A herb that acted as a natural pain killer.

Delia remembered how much Hank knew about wildness survivor and had taught her a lot about herbs. Deciding it was better then nothing, she took out a bawl from her bag and grabbed a handful of the herb. She threw the plant into the bawl and mushed it up until it was a fair paste. once it was ready, Delia set about changing the pokemon's dressing and adding the paste. Once she was finished the Pichu seem to be more at ease and resting more comfortable.

Delia sigh in relief as that was over. Suddenly a noise startled her. It sounded like a deep growling, coming from behind her? Curious, she slowly turned around and was surprised at at she saw.
15121111111.title: Lost and in Danger, Just like her son!

choices: Should she reach Littleroot town, only to have another problem?
Should her stay in Littleroot town be boring?
151211111111.content:
Delia stared into the gapping jaw of some kind of beast pokemon. It stood about 3 feet 3 inches and was black and white. Black fur cover most of the top of the creature and it's paws and tail, while white fur cover it's bully, legs and face. Black markings were around it's red eyes, forehead and the lip of its mouth. It look every dangerous.

The regressed mother made no sudden moves. She just stared into the wild pokemon's eyes, trying to recalled it's name. She had remember seeing a photo of this creature when she was visiting professor Oak's place a few weeks. Now what was this pokemon called again?

'Mightyena,' Delia said in her mind.

It was about this time that she become aware that there was more then just one pokemon at the time. Daring to look around, Delia notice about six other Mightyena, were around the one in front of her. She looked back at the Mightyena in front of her and saw something hidden in those red eyes. She had a little trouble place it, but it liked look it was concern for about something.

The Mightyena slowly moved away from Delia, but kept her eyes on the former adult. Delia followed with her eyes, careful not to make any sudden moves.

The beast-like pokemon waked up to the injured Pichu and give it a quick sniff. Once it has determined that the injure pokemon was no threat, the dog-like pokemon jumped over the fallen tree trunk that Delia was just sitting on.

Delia become curious as to what was behind there and cautious made her way over, careful not to upset the pack of Mightyena. She peeked over the fallen trunk and was very surprise at what she saw.

It was an Poochyena, the pre-evolved state of the Mightyena. It seems to be sleeping at the time, but that's when Delia notice the injure on the bit pokemon's leg.

Almost immediately, Delia forgot about her fears and gathered her medical supplies. She boldly walks up to the injure pokemon, only to have two other Mightyenas get in her way.

"Please, I just want to help," Delia said softly with pleading eyes.

The Mightyena, next to the injured Poochyena, looked at the regressed mother. It was obvious the leader of the pack and was deciding if it could trust the human. After a few heart-beats, the pack leader sides aside and it's pack followed. Delia took this as a good sign and set to work.

She dropped to her knees and began spreading the paste she had made from the herbs she found. The injured pokemon moaned as the paste came into contact with it wound. Delia spoke soft words to ease it. After that she carefully put on the medical tap, careful not to irritated the wound anymore. Once she was done, the Poochyena seemed to be more at ease.

The Mightyena was grateful and began crowding around her, licking her everywhere. Delia giggled in delight, happy that she could help. After a few minutes, she decided she had enough and kindly told the bit pokemon that she needed to get going. She quickly gathered up her stuff and carefully picked up the other injured Pokemon. She then lift with the Mightyena growling gratefully. Unknown to the regress mother, one of the Mightyena had decided to follow her and help her in need.
151211111111.title: No good deed go unoticed.

1512111111111.content:
Delia sigh a big fat sigh of relief when she saw the sign, telling her she had finally reached Littleroot town. She had spent a day and half looking for this place. And still didn't help matter that she didn't know her way around. Still she had finally made it.

Once she got into town, she ask for direction to Professor Birch's place and in a few minutes, she found herself outside of his lab. In some where it remained her of the set up of Professor oak's place, just slightly different. She was about ready to ring the door bell when someone suddenly come out of the place and would have ran into Delia if she acted quickly and move out of the way.

"Oh, I terrible sorry, young miss, but are you okay?" a rich, hearty voice asked in concern.

When Delia looked to the owner of the voice, it wasn't who she was expecting. A full grown man, wear khaki short, a blue shirt, white lab coat, sandals and a small bread, stared at her with concern in his eyes.

"Are you okay?" The man asked again.

Delia come out of her daze and nodded slowly. She then asked," Um are you by any choice, Professor Birch."

"Yes, I am," the newly named professor asked, blinking his eyes in confusion, thinking that he had seen this girl somewhere before.

Sighing in relief, she then held out the injure pokemon as she said kindly," Well it seem this Pichu have gotten hurt and I was wondering if you can look at it?"

Instantly, a huge smile appeared on his face and nodded yes, causing Delia to smile in delight. In a few minutes, the two were in Birch's lab, where the good professor, looking over the injured.

"Hmm, this Pichu doesn't seem to have any serious injures, just soar and these small wounds are well taken care of," the good professor said and then looked at Delia. "You said a farmer named Richard was taken care of this pokemon when he was injured by one his Tauros by accident?"

"That's right," Delia replied, looking at the professor.

"Now that's weird," Birch muttered, mostly to himself, looking at the Pichu again. "Why didn't he just call me on? I would have come and got this pokemon."

"I guess he just didn't think about it?" Delia said casually.

Birch looked at her in a strange way, making Delia feel slightly uncomfortable.

"Have we meant before?" he asked curiously. "I get this feeling I have seen your face before."

"Well I'm Delia and I..." Something from deep within stopped Delia from finishing her sentence.

Like it was telling that she should keep it a secret that she was actually an adult because that because person might know her son.

"I guess I just have that kind of face." she replied after a moment.

Birch probably would have kept said something, but suddenly a local burst right in, looking quit scared.

"Professor, we have a problem," the panicked ridden villager said.

"What kind of problem?" Birch asked seriously.

"You'll just have to come and see," the man said and dragged the professor out before he could do anything else.

Delia watched as they left, feeling like she should do something to help.
1512111111111.title: Finally!  LItteroot Town!

Should the figures be there for casue more problems?
15121111111111.content:
Delia couldn't just look the other way when something was wrong. So she hurried out to see if there was any thing she could do to help.

When she got outside the building, she was surprise to see the entire town, nearly over run with bikers. They all seemed to dress in the similar fashion of black jeans, shirt or no shirt, leather jackets, and those out of style haircuts in different colors.

Yo, mind telling us where we could find the good professor Birch?" a young man asked, obviously the leader of this biker gang.

"I'm professor Birch and want do you want?" Birch asked bravely as he stepped from the crowd.

The man leaned forward on his motorcycle and grinned widely. "Well we were hoping take some of your pokemon off hands," the man said cockily.

"And what were people like you want with my pokemon?" Birch asked calmly.

"It quite simple, really," the leader said, his grin turning more various. "We sell them to foolish trainers for high price. It's the easiest way of making quick duo."

"Ah, I see now, you're gang of bandit I have heard about," Birch said calmly.

"That's right, now hand over all of your pokemon or you'll learn what the Fearow gang is all about." the leader of the gang said.

"You should be ashame of yourself!" Delia said sternly after she worked her way through the crowd. "Taking something that isn't yours! did you're mothers ever teach you that?"

"Oh, lookie here, boys, we got ourselves a riot who talks like an old granny," the leader said sarcastically, causing a good chuckled form his gang.

Professor Birch got between Delia and the biker gang. "Listen, I just gave stater Pokemon to trainers, I'm not the one who take care of them when trainers send them," the good man said bravely.

For a belief second, the bicker's leader's smile flickered before it returned, more variously then ever.

"Well we're just have to see about that, now will we?" the bicker said sarcastically and threw up a pokeball.

Some of his members of his gang followed suit and after a quick light show, the air was filled with Fearow. The towns people gasped at this large number of fierce looking pokemon.

"Now I'll ask you one last time, where are you keeping those pokemon?" the leader of the gang asked rudely.

"And I'm telling you, we don't have any?" Birch said boldly.

"Well then I guess you brought is onto yourselves," the bicker said and then shouted to the bird-type pokemon. "Fearow, gave these rude townspeople some peak attack!"

With cries from the pokemon, they all drive, intent on carrying out their orders.

"Everyone! Scatter!!" Birch told the towns people.

But the people were far to frighten to move. And with the Fearow driving in at such a fast rate, no one would have been able to dodge them in time. Suddenly a fierce roar, ranged with the air, actually causing the Fearow to become startled. This allow the towns fork to move just enough to created a clear spot and surprisingly all of the Fearow crushed right into the ground.

Curious, Delia looked in the direction the large roar came from and saw a large group of shadowy creature emerging from the horizon.

Delia couldn't believe her eyes when she saw a pack of Mightyena coming into view. But these were just any old bit pokemon. No these were the pokemon that Delia had helped out more then a day again.

'But what are they doing here?' Delia wondered to herself.

Birch also looked at them curiously. He had heard that there was pack of Mightyena attacking in the woods just south of Littleroot town, but then what were they doing here?

Even the leader of the Fearow gang, Vlad, seems surprised by this. But that was quickly replaced with that various smile of his.

"Well lookie here, boys, the forks here have been holding out on us," he said to his gang arrogantly. "How much do you think we could get for a whole pack of Mightyena?"

Voices began to raise as the gang tried to name off prices at the same time. Vlad took about ten seconds of this before he rose his hand up and the gang instantly fall silent.

"We could make up prices like we normally do!" Vlad shouted in slight annoyance. "Now let get catching!!"

"Right!!" the gang shouted and the order their Fearow to get up.

Sensing the impending danger, the Mighyena packed snapped into action. The ran quickly, racing towards the tangled mass of flying pokemon. They managed to pounce on the Fearow group, but about half of that group was able to get to the air.

"Now, Fearow, use you peak attack!!" Vlad ordered.

With a various cry, the Fearow soared down, ready to attack. Surprisingly, the Mighyena just stood there, waiting for the right time. When the Fearow was in sticking range, the Mightyena dodge, once again causing the flying pokemon to collided with the ground. Not wasting time, the Mightyena used a combo of tackle and iron tail to finished the job once and for all.

The Fearow gang was surprise to see their prize pokemon defeated so easily. Vlad seemed most surprised by this. He suddenly become aware of the fact that his gang only carried those pokemon. He become very nervously at the moment and looked at the towns people.

"Umm, we're let you off the hook this time," Vlad said, trying to sound tough.

Before he could order hi man to runaway, the Mighyena pack had surrounded them, making escape impossible.

"I don't think you're going anywhere but to the police," Birch said bravely.

Delia sighed in relief glad that everything had turned out okay.

pichu needed its head eagerly and then in a bold move, jumped onto Delia's shoulder.

Then the two left the lab. When they got outside, they were meant with quite a sight. A Mightyena was sitting outside of the lab main doors.

"What are you doing here?" Delia asked.

Birch was also confused, until he remember the story that Delia had told him early.

"I think this Mightyena wants to show how thankful it is by coming with you," Birch said.

Delia decided to something. She took out one of her new pokeballs and threw it up. Mightyena must have gotten the idea because it jumped up, allowing the ball to capture it.

"All right, I caught a Mightyena!!" Delia exclaimed for no reason as she caught the ball in mid-air.

1521211.content:
"Hello, Delia," greeted Prof. Oak at the door of his laboratory.
"I heard that you just made a new invention and you need someone to test it, right?" asked Mrs. Ketchum.
"Yes, come inside!" He brought her to a strange machine. It had two tubes coming out of the sides with transparent pods at the bottom. One had a Spinarak in it; the other was empty. "This machine lets a person read the thoughts of pokémon, and vice-versa."
"Really? But why is it a Spinarak?"
"It was the only pokémon I could get to stay in the pod. So, anyways, I would appreciate it if you went into the other pod now."
So Mrs. Ketchum walked into the empty pod while Prof. Oak pressed a button on his computer. Suddenly, there were bright lights everywhere, nearly blinding her.

When she came to, she was lying on her stomach, which was strange, since the pod wasn't nearly wide enough for her to lie down. She saw Prof. Oak run over to the other pod.
"Are you okay, Delia?" he asked. He then helped her up to her feet. Only, it wasn't her, because she was in the other pod.
"What's happened to me?" she asked, but it came out as "Spina, Spinarak." She then looked at the glass and saw that she had turned into a Spinarak!

152122222222211.content:
Delia sat nervously in the uncomfortably sterile waiting room. White walls, wall to wall carpeting in an ugly pattern, chairs that were just slightly too small... Professor Oak might have been a good scientist but he obviously had no decorating skill. The waiting room had 'government funded' written all over it.

Delia was in the waiting room today because she had gone and volunteered for an untested and possibly dangerous scientificexperiment. The fusion of Human D.N.A and Pokémon D.N.A. More specifically, Delia’s and a Snorlax’s. Ever since Delia saw the large and round Pokemon walk around her parents house when she little, she had felt a strange yearning towards it. They were so big and strong, virtually invincible to everything around them. So when the opportunity arose for Delia to become Snorlax-like, she never hesitated to sign up once.

Professor Oak’s massively obese Snorlax (even for it’s species standards) sat in his small laboratory beyond the window pane of the waiting room door, it’s tremendous ass cushioned by pillows, blankets and cotton, an attempt at making the most comfortable throne possible. Itwas adorned with a fancy headdress, many shining baubles, and charcoal tattoos all over it’s expansive body, it’s own gut a canvas unto itself.

“How hospitable!” Delia exclaimned looking over through the door window. “It must be a wild Snorlax.I never thought Samuel would go out and actually catch a Snorlax. I could have sworn he already had one.” The Snorlax was a deep green color, with eyes to match. It was only slightly taller than normal Snorlax standards , and didn’t look as muscular as most Snorlaxes Delia had seen. Even for one so overweight.

It was the perfect spot really, for the Snorlax, for both private intimacy an stuffing. Automated snack bars—oversized vending machines that served all kinds of food—were plentiful around the otherwise empty laboratory hat overlooked the small village of Pallet Town on a hill.

Delua grew finicky in her own slightly too small seat. Only her arms kept her from taking off like Mary Poppins towards the great beast.

There was another reason why Delia loved Snorlaxes so much and wanted to because become more like the Big fat Pokémon. Ever hungry and ever consuming, these Pokémon are known to be extremely obese, but their body chemistry allows for it to be healthy. They are usually quite friendly, although they can be a bit testy. Secrety, not letting anyone, not even her own son Ash, to know, but she was always unsatisfied with her body. She always thought it was a bit too thin. A little Snorlax D:N.A will put some meat on her bones. And maybe in all the right places.

It had been a few minites later when Professor Oak finally arrived onto the waiting room scene.

The good Prifessor shook his head once he found out thevolunteer of his latest experiment was Delia. He regrettably pulled out his clipboard and wrote down her name in advance. By this point in time, Delia’s gluttonous appetite (which she had kept hidden from Ash) became a fixture of the relationship he grew to accept, if not find endearing from time to time. He dated a women he cooked some pretty damn good food after all. He could put up with the houswife’s relentless stomach most of the time although it wasn’t uncommon for a buffet or deli to run out of food by the time Delia sated her desire. Samuel had to plan well in advance if he wanted to invite his girlfreind over for dinner. He learned the hard way that he essentially dated two people; Delia and her appetite. He treated her stomach as a separate guest, learning over time to make enough food to go around.

As Ash was put going on his adventures across the Pokémon World, Delia had put on a considerable amount of weight, letting her appetite flourish with reckless abandon. A sizable potbelly spilled out from underneath her shirt onto her lap fully exposed for the word to see. Her thighs threatened to snap the seams of her pants more and more every day. A cute double chin and chipmunk cheeks appears on Delia’s face, as well as an expanded booty and cleavage, once considered flat, now almost appearing busty.

"Delia, are you sure you want to go through with this? This is a permanent and life changing decision your making here. I dont care if you think I'm against you, huh I want to make sure my girlfriend does not regret this for the rest of her life.”

“I think I did pretty good with my decision making, Samuel, but I wouldn’t mind if you spent a little more time with me on what you were working on before. That way I would have sighted up earlier.” Delia snorted. She found it easy to be himself around Professor Oak, and strived to impress the good Professor every chance she got. SHe couldn’t care less about the consequences tself or if she lived to regret her choice, what she wanted right here and right now was Gibbs in that room with the big beautiful Snorlax Inside.

Aw, that's no problem. In fact, that was what I intended.” Professor Oak pointed his thumb backwards. “I just want you to follow me to the back.”


—and with that Delia sped behind Samuel like a Subst out of the Distprtion world into the main laboratory where the Snorlax was housed. Wide-eyed she watched the giantPokémon glut. Occupied with it’s giant feast, it had not yet realized the presence of Delia entering the room. The growls of it’s blubber ladden belly was music to the mother’s ears.

Professor Oak walked into the room with a wobble and chuckled. “Well then, we should probably begin the procedure right away, huh?”

Delia smirked and brushed the creamy furred belly of the Snorlaxwith her hand, reveling at the feeling of Pokémon blubber against her palm “Awwww, It’s so cute!”

As the Snorlax ate the food that was provided to it, somewhere in the back of it’s mind did it register the feeling of something rubbing against it’s gut. Looking down, the fat Pokémon made eye contact with the fat human, who smiled back at it with a friendly demeanor. The Snorlax smiled back, but soon the mountains of snack food piled around him gave him reason to feast further.

1521222222222111.content:
She was in rare form this morning. Every step she pu ton earth was calculated, precise, and in perfect position. It would be another easy win for the fastest pokemon in the city. Every day she raced, everything. The wind, birds, human driving through the streets, and like the lightning bolt she was, the blue or orange was always in first place.

Stopping at the finish line, she looked behind her, waiting for her defeated competitor. 'Heh, that makes well over 2000 races I've been able to beat him in.' Waiting for her opponent gave The Raichu time to reflect on the morning. The wind was wonderful today, and the conditions for her agility had been perfect, but then, when one was as fast as her, the conditions rarely meant anything. 'Ever since I evolved into a Raichu, nobody has been able to match my speed.' She thought to herself. Such an idea might seem vain, but the electric mouse was more than capable of backing it up. Trains, taxing planes, race cars, not to mention every other pokemon within hundred miles had all been defeated by her astounding agility and the adrenaline rush that came with triumph was common to the Riachu.

Finally, a cyclist came rushing down the street, out of breath and looking defeated. “Well, finally you show up!” A sly look adorned her face with the completion of her morning warm up, a race with her trainer. She barely came up to the top of his of his wheel, but she always looked up at him in triumph.

Screeching to a halt next to her, he spoke in between pants. “I don't see why I've even tried to beat you these past two years.” Ash could never understand the speech of his best friend, but from the way a smile stretched across her face to the way her long tail wagged back and forth, he guessed that she was chiding him for his loss. Sitting on his bike obscured what Ash really looked like. Leaning forward made him seem short, but he was five foot nine inches tall, which was pretty good. His naturally messy raven black hair partly covered up his forehead, and years of trying to keep up with his Raichu had kept him in shape, and given him a muscular physique that was easy to maintain when he had to eat on the budget of a Pokémon Trainer.

It had been five years since Ash started his Pokemon Journey, and he had matured along the way. The once naive, curious little ten year old had grown up into a strapping younge man. Along with Ash, his trusty and loyal Pikachu had also grown up, or in a better term evolved. But despite their appearances being different, they were still the same people underneath from when they first went out on their great journey together.

After a long time, the fifteen year old trainer had finny arrived back in Pallet Town to take a short break from the Pokémon league.

“Rai, rai chu! Aichu Ra!” she said in a happy voice, “Oh, but its fun racing you here!” Ash was glad to see his little buddy be so happy. But truth be told, he was incredibly stressed out and overworked inside, which was partly the reason why they were taking this sudden vacation. In the early years of his journey, Ash had gotten by good training, bonds with his Pokémon, and a little bit of good luck. But now that he was in the big leagues, all of the sudden everyone seen Ed to take off the training wheels of Pokémon training and made this last year the hardest one so far.

Of course, looking down at the cutest and fuzziest speed demon in all of Kanto always made Ash’s problems seem far away. Two years had passed since Ash had found a lightning stone for her but Raichu’s evolution hadn't changed their a relationship a bit, except that now he never stood a chance against her in races. “Well congratulations to you, again.” Picking the mouse up in a fast motion, he rubbed there noses together, which always made Ash’s Raichu giggle. She'd wrap her long tail around him and spark her cheeks. The sight was far to cute for Ash to pass up.

“Come on,” Ash held Raichu down to his chest. “Let’s head on in. My mom’s waiting on us.” They we're in front of the Ketchum household all along and we're walking into the doorway, not expecting at all what lies behind the thin wooden door.

-----------------------------

Delia woke up slow with a slight, “Mrrrrr…” The summer sun was sparkling in through her window and played across her round, verdant green-furred face. Her pudgy cream-furred paw scratched at her white, soft, flabby belly. Smiling, making her cheeks puff even more and her double chin almost become a triple, she threw his tree-trunk like legs over the edge of the bed and sat up, delighting in the feeling of heaviness – her belly took up most of her lap and her bloated breasts rested on top of that. With a grunt, she pushed herself up off of the bed, standing up on her thickened cream furred feet and setting her belly jiggling. Tugging at the waistband of her panties, she waddled over in front of her full-length mirror and admired her profile. There was no doubting it, she was fat, and loved it. Delia pinched a fat roll on her side, loving how well the Pokemon experiment turned out, Making her a beautiful Snorlax Human hybrid. She stood at 6ft and weighed 420 lbs.

Not wanting to become immobile, Delia still worked out, riding an exercise bike and lifting weights enough to keep her in shape to move her big self around. Professor Oak was surprised that a women her size was as healthy as she was. Her size didn’t go to her head, however. Delia stayed just as friendly and jovial as she ever was.

Suddenly, she heard the doorbell ring and rem breed today was he say that Ash was coming home! Delia waddled over to her door, opening it as her Son, Ash, walked by. He turned to her and…

15212222222221111.content:
“DEAR ARCEUS!” Ash yelled as the door opened to reveal not his mother, but some kind of Snorlax suffer into his mother’s clothing. Raichu almost immediately took a defensive stance in font of Ash, seeing this imposter as a threat. However, nothing could have prepared them for what happened next.

“Ash!” The Snorlax cries out in a voice that was exactly like Delia’s, trampling over Raichu under her new wide paws as she rushed towards her baby boy. Ash was so caught off guard that he didn’t even try to get out of the way. In an instant the fat Pokemon/Human hybrid collided with his form and they both were sent tumbling down to the ground, Delia’s weight crushing the living daylights out of Ash.

“Oh Ash! It’s so good to see you again! I told you to call me more often but your always so busy with your silly battles. But none of that matters now, I’m just so happy that my little boy is home!” Delia squealed while her form finally stopped jiggling from the impact.

“...mom?” Ash asked cautiously, not sure what to make of the situation he was currently in. “Is that...is that really you?”

“Of course I’m me sweetie!” Delia smiled, making her apple sized cheeks puff up even more. “Don’t tell me your surprised about my new body, I told you all about it in the emails I sent you.”

“You said you went under an experiment for prof. Oak, not that you became a Snorlax!” Ash yelled, and instantly regretted it as his lungs collapsed under the weight of his mothers flabby body.

“Oh Ash, don’t blow things so out of proportion, I’m still me on the inside. I’m just different on the outside. Now come on.” Delia effortlessly got up from the ground like she wasent weighed down by 400+ lbs of blubber on her frame. “I’ve made us a special meal for your trip back home. Come on now, before the food gets cold.”

And with that, Delia turned around and walked back into the house expecting Adh to follow her, accidentally stoping Raichu again on the way in. Ash sat there on th ground for a few moments before silently getting back up. He scratched his head. Maybe...this was all a dream, he thought. Carefully, he picked up Raichu, hurt, but not enough for it to be serious, and walked inside his childhood home, finding that it had changed radically.

The house, once lively furnished with plants and fixtures, was now creepily devoid of anything at all. The living room had gone under a drastic change, once serving a sofa, two armchairs and a television, now consisted of a television, and a couch broken beyond repair from being sat on too many fine by a Snorlax women. The hallways no longer had any pictures, most likely they kept shaking off the wall whenever Delia walked bg, and were startally bars.

Ash didn’t have much time to adjust to his new home, as Delia called him from the kitchen slash dining area. “Ash, Pika-oh sorry-Raichu! Don’t keep a mother waiting!”

Reluctantly, Ash, with Raichu in his arms, walked into the kitchen, to find a feast had been prepared on their table. Food was overflowing from all sides and corners of the relatively meager sized dinner table, the sheer weight of the food alone making the old wood cream under pressure. Cooked Pokemon meat of all kinds, pastries and berries, and all manners of succulent foods had been placed and stacked big in the table, decorated to give off that shame of decadence that a Pokemon trainer living off camp food could only dream about.

“Do you like it?” Delia said, stepping into Ash’s peripheral vision. “I spent all day preparing it, nothing but the best for a member of the Ketchumn family!”

“Uhhh...wow, geese...’mom’.” Ash felt a bit uneasy using that word to describe the creature in front of him. “Thanks but...I don’t think me and Raichu will be able to finish all this, even with our appetites.”

“Hmm, oh no no no Ashy. This food is it for you, Yours is over there.” Delia pointed over the mountain of fattening food towards a soft de table in the kitchen, with a plate of just as delicious looking, but far much smaller looking food.

“Oh! Uh...okay, but who gonna eat-?” Ash tried to get a sentence out, but his mothers already wandered the question as she dove straight into the food without hesitation. She was sitting down on the tiled floor, her weight to much to support a chair anymore, and ate without abandon, like the last bit of food on earth was in front of her and she had not eaten for days.

Slowly, Ash averted his eyes from his ‘Mothers’ feast, and went to eat his own plate of food, while Raichu was let down to have a prepared bowl of Pokémon chow next to the side table. Ash sat down and took a bite from the food, it was roasted pidgeot. He tried to avoid eating Pokémon, there were his line and joy mind you, but still, it tasted amazing. He tied to drown out the sounds of Delia munching away with thoughts like “What am I going to do to Professor Oak when I see him today?” Or “Plese oh please let this all be a dream!”.

By the time that Ash and Raichu had finished there respected meals, they turned around to see that despite having a far larger amount of food, Delia had kept pace with them and was finished with her meal too. Not a scap of edible matter was left on the table. The pots and pans licked clean, the plates absolutely barren of anything food related whatsoever, everything was now stewing inside Delia’s Snorlax gut.

And it showed, it really showed. Her gut was big before, but now it was a huge yoga ball of fur and fat. The undigested mass of food in her stomach had yet to be churned into useless chime, and was sitting pretty on Delia’s frame, waiting to turn into fat. Delia, however, was more or less completely unfazed with her stomach to size of a Taurus, and hot up from the floor not hindered in the slightest. Sighing, she placed a flawed hand in the top of her dome of a belly and slowly rubbed it luke it was alive.

“That was a good meal...” She said dreamily. “Although next time, i shouldent skimp our so much on berries.”

“Uhhh...” Ash mutters to himself as his mom patted her belly like it was his sister. “What...now?”

The excitement in the air was intoxicating, surrounding the entire arena of the Pokemon League Championship! People from across the globe and all over the region of Kanto were cheering and rooting for their favorite trainer to win. The cheering intensified as the two opponents tossed their fighters into the ring.

Red corner's first Pok�mon was Gengar, the shadow ghost Pokemon. Materializing from the bright light the Pokeball spat out, it cackled and swang its tongue in different directions.

Blue corner's Pokemon was Nidorino! The large pink creature let out a loud roar and began sliding and kicking its paws into the ground.

With the cheers increasing in volumes and the two battling Trainers all set for their first round, the starting bell rang. The two Pokemon charged straight towards one another, with Nidorino starting things off with its Tackle attack.

"Nidorino starts out with an amazing Tackle attack! Oh! But it was no good! Gengar easily dodges it with its quick speed and jumped off of the Pokemon! Oh, what's this!?" The announcer shouted through his microphone. Gengar, with that huge smile of his, began moving its paws in front of it, waving them in small circular motions. "Oh my! It's Gengar's special attack, Hypnosis! A powerful Psychic move that puts any Pokemon asleep! Will Nidorino get out of this okay?!" The pink Pokemon slowly wobbled, fighting hard to not fall asleep.

"Looks like the trainer has recalled his Pokemon! What kind of Pokemon will be sent out next?!" The announcer screamed out, and then slammed his hands onto his desk dramatically as the next Pokemon to be sent out from the blue corner, is a mighty Onix! "Wow! It's heavy-weight and hitter rock snake Pokemon, Onix!"

The rock Pokemon roared and immediately dove straight towards Gengar. It slammed into the Ghost-type Pokemon, causing it to fly upwards, but it quickly repositioned itself upright. It quickly retaliated by firing off its Nightshade attack! It missed after the Onix quickly moved its head to the right and lifting itself from the ground.

"The excitement in this stadium is amazing, as people and trainers around the world are witnessing the battle of history! None of our combatants seems to be tired, and won't give up the fight. With their Pokemon sharing blows after blows of attacks off one another, who knows who will come out on top!" exclaimed the excited announcer, who is shouting and screaming. Giving play by play of what's going on in the battle in front of him.

Watching from the comfort of his small TV, a young man dons his green fingerless gloves as his brown eyes watch the riveting battle in front of him.

"Alright! I knew this battle would be exciting, and with those strong Pokemon in the battlefield, it makes me even more psyched to start my own Pokemon journey!" He announced. The 14 year old boy's name was Ash Ketchum.

He had always dreamed of starting his own Pokemon journey. Children who are of the age 14 can start their official Pokemon journey, and are required to receive their first starter Pokemon from a nearby Professor, as well as their Trainer's license.

Ash grabbed a Voltorb clock off of his drawer and raised it above his head. "I, Ash Ketchum, hereby decree that I will go out and catch every Pokemon out there. To become the greatest trainer of all time, a Pokemon Master!" He thrust the ball forward. "Of All-!"


"Ash!"

And this, dear readers, is where the similarities between the traditional Pokemon anime and this story ends. But before we move on, let's provide some origin story on the REAL star of the show, Delia Ketchum.

Delia is the single mother to Ash, who, over time, used her son to get things her way. She was fat, not chubby fat, but 643 lbs of raw blubber fat, and she always has been. Her father used to call her my little munchlax, but she had to drop the weight when she got married. However, once the father of Ash passed away for very sad reasons, Delia resumned her gluttonous behavior in full forse. She used Ash as a taste tester to see what recipes tasted the best, giving her the reputation of the greatest chef in Kanto.

But Delia had other plans for her son just then being a taster. When Ash proclaimned that he wanted to become a Pokemon trainer, Delia gave her belessing on only one condition: She got to go on the journey with him. Delia claimned it was so she could better protect his presious boy while he was out on his big and scary journey, but the reality was that she was trying to live through him. Her parents never let her go on a journey when she was a child, but now she had the perfect excuse.

Don't get the wrong idea about her, though. She still cares for Ash, she is his mother after all. She just caress about herself more.


Delia barged into Ash's room, knocking down the wooden door with her fatty, exposed stomach that hung over her sagged all the way down to her knees like it was an apron. Her shirt had long stopped making an effort to contain the thing.

"What are you doing? It's half past ten! You gotta be ready for my big--I mean our---I mean...YOUR big day tommarrow!"

Ash visably shrank under Delia's imposing and looming figure. Years of eating and glutting had not only made her wider but taller as well. Where Ash was 5.5ft, his mom was a dominating 7.1ft. All the doors in the house had to be widened to accomadate her. "But mom, I'm too excited to sleep!" Ash whined.

Delia gave Ash a scolding glare and placed her hands on her butt, flaring out so much it looked like she was hiding a baby Snorlax in the tathered remains of her skirt. Delia grabbed the remote out of Ash's hands into her pudgy ones, and changed the channel to a documentary hosted by Professor Oak.

"Now you better be asleep by midnight, young man. Or else you'll get the chair again." And with that, Delia strolled out of her son's room and shut the door.
